programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: A semi-detached destined to be the buyers' home in Felixstowe, a seven-year project to transform a tired bungalow to help the community in Willenhall and a trendy warehouse apartment in Toxteth are sold under the hammer. Martin, Dion and Tommy check out the projects and meet the developers.

programme.title: Coast to Coast Food Festival
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher and Edith Bowman explore Cockermouth's food festival, meeting passionate food producers and getting tips on homemade pitta bread from a MasterChef winner. Cookery writer Michaela Chiappa discovers how seaweed is being harvested for food, and chef Julie Lin gets the low down on low-fat, semi-skimmed and full-fat milk. Chef Suzie Lee reveals how top chefs are getting creative as they reduce food waste.

programme.title: Coastal Defenders
programme.desc: A luxury floating hotel in London's docklands has a rusty bottom, and the Coastal Defenders dive team are charged with making it shipshape once more. The team are then faced with danger on the water as they attempt to rescue a stricken cruise liner amid one of the winter's worst storms. With a £300 million pound boat in the frame, the team take no risks on this job for fear of scratching the priceless vessel.

programme.title: Nicky Campbell BBC News Talk
programme.desc: Nicky Campbell takes your calls on the day's talking points, hearing views and experiences from across the UK. Call 08085 909693 between 9am and 11am on weekdays (calls are free from mobiles and landlines).

programme.title: Politics Live
programme.desc: Join presenter Jo Coburn as she discusses the latest political news and stories in a conversational format, covering the comings-and-goings from Westminster in the BBC's daily politics programme. Featuring opinions and arguments from all the sides of the political spectrum, the show invites informed and opinionated guests to share their views on the stories of the day.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Yasmine Akram, Cariad Lloyd, Geoff Norcott and Dennis Taylor test their general knowledge.

programme.title: B&B By the Sea
programme.desc: Hollyoaks star and comedian Richard Blackwood is checking in to the B&B.

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace visits a Yorkshire team that churn out up to 90,000 vegan sausages a day! Heck have been making these bangers since 2018, and the process is surprisingly futuristic. Meanwhile, Cherry Healey discovers how Canadian soy beans are transformed into protein-packed tofu, and she heads to the Scottish coast to harvest a vegan superfood of the sea. Historian Ruth Goodman uncovers the green shoots of the vegetarian movement in Britain and the high price that British sailors paid when deprived of their five a day.

programme.title: Highland Cops
programme.desc: Officers on Skye struggle to keep a royal visit from the future king under wraps.

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: In-depth news and current affairs review of the main political and economic stories of the day, featuring robust interviews with senior government and opposition figures, business and trade union leaders.

programme.title: Pilgrimage: The Road to Istanbul
programme.desc: Seven well-known personalities meet in Portugal to tackle a modern Catholic pilgrimage.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: Nine cooks face an audition test, in which they must cook a family favourite dish.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: Seven cooks return to face a challenge set by food critic William Sitwell.
